intro: Ctenitis aripensis, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Dicksoniaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can live for several decades, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fronds are typically green on the upper surface and lighter in color on the underside. Ctenitis aripensis plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's native forests, providing habitat and contributing to biodiversity.
